title: Great surgery
body: I have many medical issues. At all times I have had amazing treatment. Communication and getting an appointment can be difficult but they are understandably busy. I do think that the surgery was better when it was at Carisbrooke but that is out of their hands. I think that they do a great job and cannot thank them enough

author: xmasbabe21
title: Feeling like a nuisance
body:
I was admitted through A&E to ward 2a in March where I was placed in room 201. The next day I saw the consultant on duty and discussed the treatment plan for abscesses on both right and left legs. I had already seen ortho on call team at A&E on the Tuesday for this on going issue and we decided to put me on the urgent ultrasound list and let me go home. I was told to expect a call on the Wednesday morning with a time to come in for the ultrasound.  
I had still not received a call by Thursday afternoon so contacted the trauma liaison and was told my name was on list and I would have to just wait. So when spoke to consultant on the Sunday we decided for me to still wait on ultrasound.  
On Sunday I was moved to another bed in my room. I raised concerns about this as I was nebulising for my Asthma and had no access to either an oxygen port or nebuliser machine. I had no buzzer and as someone who is known to take asthma attacks n the night this was concerning. I also had no light so if every light on ward went out at night I had no light to see. This is important as I have a sight impairmentBy the Wednesday I had not seen a doctor from the Sunday and was still waiting on the ultrasound which had been waiting on from the previous Tuesday and had to chase up with the nurse about not seeing doctor. I eventually saw Consultant and they said they would try and chase up the ultrasound. I got the ultrasound on Thursday afternoon and had surgery on the Friday afternoon. But when I arrived back up to the ward I was placed in bed area 7 again even though I had had a GA and nurses could not see me and monitor me. I am still in this position and if there is a problem during the night I can get help as now even though I have a bell the staff can not here it.The nurses on the ward are doing an amazing job for the situation the are in. As a regular in patient I can say this is the worst admission I have experienced and I feel like I have been dumped in a corner and feel like I am a nuisance even though the nurses have tried hard not to make me not feel like this.I have had been having ongoing issues in regard to my care with this health condition and am covered in scars all over. I have seen orthopaedics and surgical arguing in front of me as to who has to treat me. A&E know me very well due to my other health conditions and have said I shouldn't really be going to them as it is an ongoing known condition and not an emergency. They have said there should be a care plan/Treatment pathway sorted.The issue with this is I don't know when to come in as when I come in early to try and prevent it from becoming a big abscess I am sent home. I am told there nothing there but most of time I'm in 2 or 3 days later with a bigger abscess and have to be admitted and go under a GA. The shortest time for this to happen is 3.5 hours. I was an inpatient and told them that this was the situation but was not listened to. By time got home it had a head on it. I refused to come back because of this and waited on it popping 2 days later and then went to A&E to have it dealt with. Then if I wait till it is large I am asked why didn't I come in sooner?The doctors and consultants make me feel like it is my fault or blame it on the medication I use even. A doctor has accused me of having an addiction problem when I asked for certain medication that I know I can take and am not allergic to. This doctor did not talk to me about this or any of my other care teams. I have spoken to GP's, district nurses and my support workers who have regular contact with my in community, often daily, and they had no concerns and had not been consulted about it. I have asked for this to be removed from my records but it has not been.I had a meeting with a consultant back in September/October and it was decided to organise an multidisciplinary meet with all the people involved in my care. This was nearly 6 months ago and am still waiting on this and have been told it is now on the 3rd consultant to organise it. I have had no contact or communication regarding this so don't now what is going on.Being treated as a new case every time means I don't get consistency in my care and am treated as a new trauma every time. I feel my care is not being proactive it is being reactive and just treating the problem just at that time. I know treating traumas people are only seen once or twice so doesn't matter it they always have different consultant but this doesn't work in regard to my care as every consultant tends to treat it different.The way I am cared for and treated makes me feel as if I am a nuisance and an inconvenience.

author: Mr Y
title: Parking issues
body:
My aunt recently had to attend University Hospital Wishaw for a procedure at Day Surgery, I dropped her off promptly at 8:15am at the drop off point at the main entrance. I did notice staff parking their cars at the drop of point and heading into the hospital.  
When I received a call from the staff 4 hours later to say my aunt was ready for home, I was told by the staff member to park at the drop off point and come to the department as my aunt couldn't leave the department alone. When I arrived at the hospital I got out of the car I was approached by security and told I couldn't park there. I explained what I was told by Day Surgery but was told again I need to move my car. When I moved someone else pulled in behind me and they weren't asked to move. I did notice that the staff cars that parked when I dropped my aunt off were still there.  
Can you confirm what the policy is for parking and if it is different for staff and patients, as it appears that staff have priority over patients at the drop off point?

title: Fantastic Service
body: referred by my optician on 2nd march . assessment by spamedica on 15th march . surgery to remove cataract on 17th march . friendly staff throughout the building , so professional . informed thoroughly at every step . staff couldnt do enough for me . its a lengthy process at each stage so the free tea and biscuits were welcome as were the word puzzles. well done all of you .3 days after surgery and my eye is healing well the chap who went through the post op treatment was so patient and precise .

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It would just be nice to see this as an option.
body:
I came to hospital as I was having very bad chest pains and problems with my breathing. The care that I have been receiving has being good staff are friendly.  
I would say the cleanliness of the ward is very good however there was an incident were the toilet was quite dirty but once I told the cleaners about this they were quick to get the cleaned up and sanitized.  
I do feel as if there should be more variety on the menu for example sandwiches should be an option as times I do not really have that big of an appetite and sandwich’s would be beneficial because breakfast and lunch are quite close together and after breakfast I am quite full and do not have much of an appetite for lunch so something small like a sandwich would be great.  
It would just be nice to see this as an option. Overall I would say everything has been okay on this ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thorough and caring assessment
body:
I attended A&E with breathlessness and chest pains, and was seen in A&E / cardiology. The team who assessed my condition were really thorough, friendly and caring, as were the paramedics. A full series of tests was performed and ruled out immediate danger of heart problems. Not only was the treatment really professional but the doctor under took additional tests and has made recommendations to my GP. This has saved time and provided a good deal of reassurance, at least as far as my immediate symptoms are concerned.
Thank you for going the extra mile and hopefully I won’t need to see you again anytime soon!
Best wishes
John

title: Excellent X ray department
body: Fantastic service and spotlessly clean war bunker! Unusual place to have a x ray but highly recommend treatment here. Professional friendly staff who gave clear explanation of procedure. Spacious waiting area with a lovely atmosphere.

title: Phone queue
body:
What a brilliant  innovation to now give caller number in waiting queue when ringing the surgery.  Instead of clinging onto my phone while awaiting a response, hoping I don't miss response, I can now put phone on speaker and do something  else while waiting. A very simple but great idea. 
As ever...you all do a great job

title: Well managed practice
body: I chose the Beaconside practice because it was local to where I live, it was a very daunting move, because I was leaving a fabulous surgery ( Wolverhampton road surgery ), but I didn't need to worry because,my experience so far has been great, from all the staff has been a pleasant experience.I would like to ssy thanks.

title: Great doctors
body: Always so kind they have helped me a lot I always appreciate them go lovely nurses and staff  and always willing to try and help you in any way I would never leave that practice

author: Ginger4877
title: Staff doing a sterling job
body:
On arrival at the department there were 10 ambulances sitting outside to offload patients and the waiting room was extremely busy when I took my mum in. We were advised to go to A&E by her GP. My mum was triaged within half an hour, bloods taken 2 hours later, then eventually seen at 11:00pm having been in the department from 3.40pm that afternoon.  
Staff were under a lot of pressure but the empathy they showed to my mum was outstanding they deserve a medal after what I witnessed while waiting for my mum to be seen. About 9:00 pm a Manager spoke to the whole department to say that the hospital was well over capacity and that it could be a 6, 7, 8 hour wait but everyone would be seen.  
I requested more painkillers for my mum and the manager himself brought them out to my mum, which she was grateful for after reading her notes as it was suspected kidney stones and she was in a lot of pain. My mum eventually got discharged after midnight and I would like to pass on my sincere thanks to everyone in the A&E department. You all do a sterling job and deserve recognition for working in a high pressured environment.  
Thank you NHS for everything you do.

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Friendly, helpful & caring staff. Well Done!
body:
I was admitted into Craigavon area hospital a week ago and was brought up to the 2 South ward.  
The staff on this ward are very professional, the level of the care that they provide is exceptional and they really go an extra mile to make themselves as welcoming as possible.  
What an amazing service they have here at Craigavon area hospital, all from friendly, helpful & caring staff. Well Done!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have been in hospital for a while now
body:
I have been in hospital for a while now and one thing that is an issue for me is the understaffing. I understand that the staff are trying their best and working hard but it would be helpful if there was more staff on this ward.  
There have been times where others have been waiting for staff to come and take them to the toilet.  
The staff are great and are amazing at what they do, these people need a raise as they care and work they put into us patients is truly amazing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very caring and compassionate staff
body:
The background to this review is that I was sectioned under s2, and was discharged with an apology from the consultant yesterday (at the time of writing this review).

Whilst I have to admit being extremely unhappy at the loss of my liberty, I fully understand how such an injustice could occur, and must reiterate that the staff on the ward were extremely caring, and formed genuine bonds with their patients.  They are a very caring and dedicated team.

Staff members save for one, took my comments on board regarding matters I complained about (which related to minor disrespect, in the form of friendly emulation of my Tourettes tick which I have to admit is particularly "catchy" and which I would have found touching, if it were not for the fact they were my unfortunate jailers... And as such, I demanded that the appropriate boundaries be kept). One staff member however denied having done so, even though it occurred on a recorded video call which I was having with my wife at the time, and then sought to deny that any staff member would have done so (even though multiple other staff apologised to me about it when I mentioned it to them, when they accidentally did it) and then tried to gas light me, putting pressure on a patient who is under section 3 of the mental health act and thus may be on the unit for upto 6 months between reviews. 

The food, staff, accomodation and level of care and support given is genuinely touching, and as a journalist I am intending on writing a very touching article on my good experience, no matter how much of an injustice occurred to bring me to such an experience. 

I was not medicated during my stay, and do have some reasons to complain, but these by and large have little to do with the nursing, care, cleaning, pharmacy or clinical teams. 

Any individual who requires inpatient psychiatric care would do well to find themselves in such a caring environment for their treatment.

title: appointments on patient asccess
body: i would liked to know why this surgery never have any appointments that you can book on patient access this is very bad because when you ring up the surgery you can be on the line for over 20 minutes even if you press option one by the time they ring you back all of the appointments are gone if you ask can you speak to the duty doctor you are told that unless it is an emergency  they will not put to down one the list to speak to them.

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: would really like to thank all the staff who have been caring for me.
body:
Last time I was here I didn’t want to go home and this time is the same. I have been in Craigavon Area hospital for a couple of days now, the ward (3 South) is kept very clean and tidy, it’s more like home this ward as before I was situated in 2 South, it was good too but I feel that 3 South is very well managed.  
I would really like to thank all the staff who have been caring for me. Have to give a big shout out to my main nurse Anna, She makes me laugh every shift she is on, really is a lovely person she has done so much for me and has been a wonderful carer!  
What would be great to see on this ward (3 South) is another shower room. It would be helpful as we are often waiting for the showers. But other than that’s everything else is great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Won't see a 12 month old
body: After redialing 351 times, finally got through.  Had no appointments and refused to see my 12 month old.  Told to try again tomorrow or go to the hospital.

title: Helpful and nformative
body: The pharmacist was well informed  as to my particular health problems and discussed suitable treatments similar to that of a doctor. He was very accommodating.

title: Let patient speak
body: I have never had a problem with this practice. But would like to give feedback. I called to arrange appt for my father of 91yrs old just out of hospital. I was 36 in Que got to number 11 and called dropped  so I called back and was in number 21 again. When I got through I said letting you know my father home from hospital and before I could say anything else the reception interrupted me by saying we will get a discharge letter as if I was waisting her time. I was the one on the telephone over an hour . I was to make appt for bloods to be checked if she had let me finish. Take time and listen

author: aquilaxn75
title: The Delivery of my Daughter
body:
7.5 weeks ago, I gave birth to my beautiful whirlwind of a daughter in AMH. After experiencing the start of labour I called AMH triage, care and consideration was taken by the midwife on the phone. As I lived an hour away and my PMH I was advised to come in for examination.  
In triage I was seen by Hannah, she examined me and gave me options, this allowed me to feel empowered in my decision making. I explained I was red pathway but on discussion with my consultant in weeks before hand, I wished to deliver in the M/W led unit. This was 100% listened to. Helen the HCSW (who I will never ever forget) came to escort us through to the M/W led unit, the midwife on duty was Katie. Both of these absolute angels & their fast acting decision making saved my Baby’s life.  
My safety and my babies safety were of upmost concern but also my wishes. I unfortunately required a transfer to the labour ward due to excessive meconium in my broken waters. Katie and Helen escorted us through fast, my daughter was born minutes later. Unfortunately my daughter required neonatal care, my partner still got to cut her cord and although we did lose out on undisturbed golden skin to skin, the team saved my daughter’s life and that’s all that matters and did the best they could to ensure I was heard and reassured when required. As a Nurse myself the “trust” aspect of our job is massive, I found I had to put all my trust in the professionals to take care of my daughter, and they did. Overstretched professionals that are honestly remarkable. I was able to empathise with my patients in regard to trusting us as professionals to care for us as patients.  
I have heard of negative stories surrounding AMH and to be honest it was not my first choice of facilities to deliver my daughter, but due to my PMH and pathway it was safest to attend AMH. I am so glad I did. I can genuinely say I was treated with dignity, compassion, kindness and cared for holistically by every single member of staff we encountered in Triage, MW Unit, Labour ward and Ashgrove ward. Names I remember was Hannah, Helen, Katie, Kira, Kirby, Aurora, and Martha. The staff in these wards were rushed off their feet, yet they always took the time to introduce themselves at the beginning of their shift. 4h obs were obtained on my daughter as per protocol and this was never missed. My daughter’s antibiotic treatment was always timely. The ward was clean. Any questions I had were always answered and if unable to answer they’d go find out. It appeared all staff worked well as a team. Nothing was ever too much hassle.  
The only negative was as I had not anticipated to be in longer than a day, I required some medication that was unstocked on the ward. I did have to chase this up several times. If I had not received this medicine it could have been detrimental to my health. I also had to ensure I had my own painkillers as I’d often asked for in the morning and I was never given. This isn’t a problem at all as I was more than happy to supply my own paracetamol etc it was just something I picked up on. I dare say if I had asked or chased this up I’d have been given no problem.  
To the staff at AMH, THANKYOU. You really are all angels. Keep up the good work. I will never forget the kindness shown and how staff went above and beyond to ensure my needs were met. Feeling very grateful. Thankyou X

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Even the doctors have been very empathic
body:
This ward is amazing for treatment as the staff have been nothing but exceptional even the doctors have been very empathic and lovely towards me. I have felt as if they have treated me as one of their family members the care is that good. From the moment I arrived onto the ward every member of staff has been professional and so kind.  
The cleanliness of the ward is great, the bedding is very comfortable and so is the food.

author: disinfectantgj68
title: Unnecessary visit to hospital
body:
Received an appointment request for reviewing my Freestyle libre pod, the letter specifically stated Grantham hospital as location. Booked the morning off work to attend, when I arrived the receptionists seemed confused where I should be (online system wasn’t working). After a few minutes was told which waiting area; while waiting for my appointment and after being booked in a nurse came and spoke to me saying there has been confusion as it’s a telephone consultation. The letter specifically stated the hospital as the location, and more infuriatingly I’d wasted a holiday to attend something I didn’t need to attend.  
As I’ve recently started a new role so my holidays are limited and having to use a holiday unnecessarily is very frustrating and annoying, plus the receptionist could have clarified this at the time of arrival rather than me wasting another 25 minutes of my time. Completely unacceptable and incredibly frustrating.  
We hear how much it costs the NHS in wasted time and missed appointments but this instance just makes a mockery of the whole system; a simple booking undone by poor communication. When I did speak with the consultant they initially said they couldn’t see my notes from my recent blood tests at the local surgery, which the consultant put down to the surgery being in another county/district; When I said the surgery was in Lincolnshire the consultant then found the notes. I know consultants have hundreds of patients but surely having the relevant information before meeting the patient is basic principles (please correct me if I’m wrong).  
I know how stretched the NHS is but this whole process has left me feeling disillusioned and frustrated for such a basic appointment, not impressed and far from happy.

author: Stantheman
title: All in all brilliant nurses and doctors
body:
After waking up in excruciating pain my doctor sent me to hospital where after numerous tests including x Ray and ct scan I was diagnosed with acute appendicitis.  
I was booked in for the operation on Tues but thankfully the surgeons were extremely busy and decided to give me antibiotics instead.  
The surgeon spoke with me on Tues and we agreed to keep treating me with the antibiotics and see how it went. I'm high risk at getting put under so I was so glad he listened to me and didn't force an operation on me.  
I have to praise all of the staff extremely highly that dealt with me, they are rushed off their feet for the entire shift yet still take time to explain or comfort other patients. And also the surgeon Chris who treated me dignity and understood my reluctance to have the operation.  
All in all brilliant nurses and doctors, plus the food, when I was allowed to eat was good too .

title: Practice refuse to communicate
body: I have been having symptoms which could be cancer, and answering their econsult questions it says I need to see a doctor urgently. This practice refuse to let me have a gp appointment and put me on a waiting list which I have been told is 8 weeks long.  They have also told me to find another gp as I find difficult to communicate by telephone so they do not want me with their practice.  They have no sympathy for anybody with mental health issues.

author: decemberpr96
title: Outstanding team work and care
body:
I recently took my mum to Royal Cornwall Hospital Endoscopy unit.  
As soon as we arrived, the gentleman on reception was amazing. He went above and beyond to support not only my mum but all other service users who came to the unit after us.  
He was attentive and knowledgeable of how the day would go.  
Following our first interaction we saw 2 fabulous nurses coming in and collecting people for the procedures. They were consistently engaging and caring.  
My mum has dementia but due to being young this is often over looked, the team didn't dismiss this and kept me in the loop during the full procedure.  
My mum felt at ease while waiting for her appointment and for me, that's the main thing.

title: Access needs to be improved.
body: My experience overall of this practice is positive but there are some areas of improvement. Receptionists are very helpful and all the clinicians have been very good. However access to the surgery is difficult via econsult. You have a limited period to send in an econsult in the morning, normally only 1 hour. Although the wait times on the telephone are not long to relay the issue to reception, I find the lack of flexibility with econsult makes simple questions or requests more time consuming, especially if you are a busy working person.

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great care on the ward
body:
I have been in this ward (2 South) as I have been having very bad leg pains but the care I have been receiving has been great. The staff are all so lovely and friendly.  
Communication with staff is also great I feel like I can ask them anything and they are great at explaining things. Food is okay I just feel like there should be more of a variety on the menu. Other than that everything else has been good - I can’t complain at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: William345
title: It’s good to know we have this service that can help quickly.
body: I fell on the floor in the bedroom and could not get back up. I have a life line which picked up my fall and called Jo my right hand girl. She helps me with my everyday life. I was cold, frightened and feeling anxious. Jo came, covered me up to keep warm and put a pillow under my head. I was not hurt just could not get up. Jo called life line to get help to lift me up. Ali & Tracey came out from first Community Response team who where brilliant helped me get dressed checked me over to see that I was ok. Thank You both it’s good to know we have this service that can help quickly.

title: How long is a piece of string?
body: Contacted them 02/03 and my reply was I needed an appointment and had to wait for one to become available, it's been 3 weeks! It seems I could be waiting 1 day or 1 year for an appointment! I never had a problem before my practice merged into this I don't even know what doctors practice out of there. There's no personalisation....sad times.

author: pink sister
title: My first ever operation
body:
As a very anxious patient having my first ever operation, on my breast I honestly couldn't of wished for a better experience.  
Nothing was to much trouble Becca and Bex who looked after me made me feel so at ease such caring nurses who simply went above and beyond to make me comfortable.  
You only hear bad stories but there is nothing bad about mine. Nurses don't get enough credit even though they are rushed off there feet and working long hours. These two nurses couldn't of done any more for me thank you so much for looking after me so well ❤️

title: Good practice
body: I have been trying to get an apointment to see the doctor for the past 2 weeks but every time I call at 8  in the morning the answering machine tells me they are experiencing high call volume and I have to call some other time. Really frustrated as I’m not feeling well. Can’t go to A&E as I will be referred back to my GP but it’s impossible to see the GP. Wonder why they are taking new patients.

author: Aries68
title: Completely put at ease
body:
Dr Bretland was brilliant. She explained everything that was going to happen and what I could expect. She went through the consent form with me and made sure I knew what I was consenting to. She also gave me extra information to pass to my doctor.  
She was calm, approachable , efficient and very professional throughout my visit. She put me completely at ease and was really patient. I would definitely recommend the clinic to my friends and family based on my visit. Thank you

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Respiratory has been a pleasant experience
body:
Respiratory is a great ward. They all know what they are doing and I like that since I know I am getting the best care then. The level of care I am receiving is excellent and I could not fault it.  
The staff are really kind and approachable. They are never too far for anyone to reach and really try their best. They are such a prime example of what we want health care professionals to be like, they are professional but also talk to us and have the craic.  
Respiratory has been a pleasant experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male medical is impressive
body:
Male medical is good, I have to admit. The food is good which is surprising I was expecting it to be worse. The ward can be noisy but I do not mind as it keeps me entertained.  
The staff are good, the really know what they are doing. They tell me everything to do with my health and what they plan on doing which is quite helpful. I like that they talk to you even though it can be when they are showering you, it is not awkward as I expected it to be thankfully.  
Male medical is impressive.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good Hospital
body:
Went in for day surgery, and was impressed with treatment from the word go. The wards were spotless and well organised, and the treatment received from the surgical team was first class. I was introduced to the surgeon and anaesthetist who informed me of what was going to happen. The after care team again were very friendly and professional. 
I cannot fault anything, and thank them all for everything they did for me.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
